website_summaries.verdict: The Meater is a reliable and worthwhile tool if meat makes up a big part of your diet.
pros: The $69 Meater wireless temperature probe connects via Bluetooth to your device, so you can easily track the internal temperature of your food while it cooks
The Meater also looks cool, and it's easy to find a place for it in your kitchen
cons: Connecting the Meater to Wi-Fi is a convoluted process
And you might not agree with its recommendations for the internal temperatures at which you should stop cooking your food

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this.
customer_reviews.text: I was really excited about this probe, but that was dashed when I realized that the blue tooth range while in a grill is about 3 feet. They say no worries just use the WiFi feature, but don"t tell you it must be connected to a separate device in order to accomplish this feat. I had to put my Samsung Pad under the grill just to get a connection to the device just so it would stay connected to my phone. Like Zak Morris, this device is trash!!!
customer_reviews.author: Alice

customer_reviews.title: Might wait for an updated version. Until then stay away.
customer_reviews.text: I might have gotten a bad one. I liked the idea of this thermometer. It wouldn’t stay connected however and range was 10 ft maybe if you’re lucky. It was hard to get reconnected during my first cook. It never connected again after that.
customer_reviews.author: Motoscooter

customer_reviews.title: Takes the guessing out of cooking
customer_reviews.text: This is one of those things in life you stumble on and think, where have you been my whole life? It just makes sense and it works. I'm not going to claim I'm a chef just yet, but I just cooked the best Ribeye steak I've ever done. Instead of stressing out and sticking a thermometer into the steak every few minutes waiting for it hit 160 degrees, I let my iPhone tell me when to remove it from the grill. Cooking this steak has gone from becoming this black magic crap shoot, to one of just a simple repeatable procedure.
customer_reviews.author: Pragmatist

customer_reviews.title: Returned
customer_reviews.text: If I wanted this for large cuts off meat like a pork butt it probably would have been better but I returned this. You have to stick the probe into the meat much farther than a usual thermometer so this was not good choice for daily use like with pork chops or chicken breasts. The temperature read done too soon because it was almost sticking out the other side. The signal was too weak for me to leave the kitchen in my tiny townhouse. I believe they recently released a new model with a signal-boosting base. That one might be better but the probe is still a problem for me.
customer_reviews.author: Dorian

customer_reviews.title: Awesome idea, mine didnt work right.
customer_reviews.text: Was so excited about getting this,but to my dismay didnt work as advertised. Only holds a bluetooth connection within a couple feet of my grill, not great for a wireless thermometer that you assume and is advertised to be able to easily go 20 feet to my couch inside. Also ambient temp readings were a good bit higher on the Meater than the built in thermometer on my grill. Had my grill set on and grill probe was showing 325 and the app was telling me to remove the probe from the grill as it was exceeding its max temp of 520 degrees.
customer_reviews.author: jason mauney

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this one
customer_reviews.text: I don't like giving negitave reviews, but this is not a good item to cook with. the range is about two feet from the grill, it worked fine the first two times I used it and then, it worked no more. So I returned it at a loss to me. So save yourself some money and look at other thermometers. This one is no good.
customer_reviews.author: mnm6080

customer_reviews.title: Horrible customer service
customer_reviews.text: Loses connectivity continuously, support is from 1 to 3 business days and by email only. Too bad you need support when you are using it not in 1 to 3 days. Don't waste your money and time. Bluetooth is only about 10 feet, Wi-Fi rarely works with the link or the cloud. And if you don't have a second device to leave right next to your grill forget about it. Highly dissapointed.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Ruell

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after only 2 hours
customer_reviews.text: My husband used the new Meater for 2 hours and followed the instructions and tips, but it stopped working. Is there a return policy or replacement policy? Thank you for your help.
customer_reviews.author: Vera Lee

customer_reviews.title: ... now for about 6 months and its been working great! The cooks are extremely accurate and my meats ...
customer_reviews.text: I first came across Meater through Kickstarter and have been using it now for about 6 months and its been working great! The cooks are extremely accurate and my meats have been cooking to perfection. You can monitor your cook easily from your mobile device and what's nice is that the app will even tell you the time remaining until you reach your desired temperature. Because the probe measures the temperature of the meat AND the ambient temperature you get really precise reads. This has pretty much become my go-to gift for all occasions and everyone has loved it! Super precise cooks...great gift idea!
customer_reviews.author: DJ W

customer_reviews.title: Takes the guessing game out of cooking perfect meat
customer_reviews.text: Love it! I’ve used it several times since I got it and it’s so useful! Takes the guessing game out especially cooking meat you don’t want to cut into prior to eating. I’ve used it in the oven, steamer (for whole fish), grill and even smoker..yes we have lots of cooking vessels. I like that it comes in a stylish box easy for storage on the fridge. Be careful removing it after cooking though, it’s really hot and I learned the hard way. Whoops. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: FL

customer_reviews.title: SAVE YOUR MONEY!! LOUSY PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: Lousy product. 100 degrees difference between MEATOR and Ambient Temperature. Does not cover all cuts of meat in setting up cooking. Doesn't read internal temp correctly. Supposed to be able to move 30 feet away from MEATOR.... NOPE, cannot move more than 3 feet away or connection drops. No way to calibrate or even reset the MEATOR. LOUSY product, great advertising plot. SAVE YOUR MONEY!!! DO NOT PURCHASE.....
customer_reviews.author: Ronald Morris

customer_reviews.title: Great in theory but can't take the heat
customer_reviews.text: Wireless probes just aren't ready for BBQ. I really wanted this probe to work but besides being cumbersome to operate via the app, the bottom line is it can't take the heat. Anything over 300 it starts to malfunction and if you think about it, that limits a lot of cooking scenarios. I hate to post a bad review and I hope others out there have better luck than I did but my Meater lasted one BBQ session and it quit on me. I had to send it back.
customer_reviews.author: Capt. Craig

customer_reviews.title: Bluetooth range pathetic
customer_reviews.text: Says range is 33 ft, I literally cant go 5 feet away with my phone or else it disconnects. I had to leave my phone outside and send link to the cook to my tablet so I could watch it and go outside to check messages nonstop. For the price, this should work much better
customer_reviews.author: Robert R.

customer_reviews.title: Sadly it didn't last
customer_reviews.text: Bought this in December. Saw the little flag on it that said it "must be inserted this far to avoid damage", so I did. Worked like a charm for 3 meals... steaks steaks, and a turkey. Super cool technology! Tried it tonight (Jan 12) and my phone couldn't find it. Problem with it's wi-fi I guess. I was so excited to have a tool like this but they apparently need to refine it. Sorry to return, I really am. But if it quits working after a month or so? No other choice.
customer_reviews.author: Peace and Love 2U

customer_reviews.title: Cool Gadget
customer_reviews.text: This thing is really cool. Very simple to use. I have smoked with it twice so far. I smoked a pork shoulder and it came out perfect. That took 15 hours and the battery had plenty of charge to keep up. I just smoked a turkey breast, and again it was perfection. I love the UI. Just tell it what you are cooking and it does the rest. Tells you how long to keep your food cooking, and how long it needs to rest. I love this thing. I will probably get the MEATER block when it comes out.
customer_reviews.author: Ator28

customer_reviews.title: Works perfect but the range just isn't there
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this thermometer but my one complaint is the range. It's incredibly accurate and gives you a great amount of information but without signing up for the Meater unlimited range thing through the app, the range is incredibly short. I definitely would not say the range is 33ft like advertised. However that's genuinely my only complaint about the product. Otherwise I love it and use it for almost everything. Especially oven cooks or smoking cooks. Would definitely reccomend to anyone
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Parker Ramey

customer_reviews.title: 33 feet my ass...
customer_reviews.text: It works great as long as you don’t mind standing right next to it the entire time. I set my iPad up within 18” of it. The only thing between it and the thermometer was the lid and the window screen. It’s utterly useless. It constantly loses connection even under these seemingly acceptable conditions. It won’t pick up the connection unless you are within inches of it, which kind of defeats the purpose. If I had known it would be this annoying, I definitely would not have bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Meeseeks

customer_reviews.title: Awesome thermometer, terrible range
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome for hitting the right temperature and knowing when your food will be done. I love the app and presets. But the 33ft range is a bald faced lie, I have to leave my phone right next to the oven or grill (less than 5 feet). I had gotten my friend the extended range one and was impressed, but since I wasn't smoking things and would be in the kitchen I opted for the cheaper model. Mistake, get the extended range one and enjoy perfectly done meats.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Hein

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant Engineering with a Caveat. Short Range, and Not Submersible in Oil
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to love this, there are so many great features. The first time I used it, there was no problems. The software is extremely intuitive, as well as the directions. Everything about the software is brilliant. It warns you if the grille is too hot, it tells you when to remove your food from the grille. Really just a brilliant piece of engineering. However, even during my first use the bluetooth signal would keep dropping out, and I was 15 feet away. I got about 6 uses out of it and it died completely. I changed the batteries in the storage unit, and it would never again appear to be discoverable, even after several resets.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Carpenter

customer_reviews.title: Works great, prevents overcooking
customer_reviews.text: I use an old cell phone on Android 5.0 to extend the range of the device. The phone connects bluetooth and transmits to my main cell phone over my Meater Cloud Account. My cell notifies me when the cook is done...and I can check current temperature of the oven and the food...and it guesstimates total cooking time. With the above setup it works well for me. Makes roasting meat easy and convenient... Set any temperature for the final internal temperature and it will tell you when the food is done...no worry about slow ovens or guessing when the food is done. Let's you cook at low temperatures without having to guess how long it will take.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Liggett

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money
customer_reviews.text: My dad asked for this for a gift and I didn’t bother to read the reviews. I wish I would have. He was unable to use it for the reasons he wanted to. He’s an avid griller and often slow cooks his food. You can see the grill from his bedroom and it isn’t far. The Bluetooth doesn’t work from his room. In fact, once he walks about 3 ft away, it doesn’t work. The directions said to connect it to another device. This was totally against the purpose of buying it. Save your money and buy a digital thermometer for $5.99.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bluetooth range is horrible
customer_reviews.text: I needed a new probe for a cook this weekend. I decided to purchase this probe because I had procrastinated and could get 2 day shipping. It says that the bluetooth range is up to 30 ft. I could not get further than 10 feet away before it would lose signal. This is the case on my iPad Pro as well as my Samsung S9+. I like the app, but I the range of this probe is not good. I really don't want to sit next to the grill or leave a smart device next to it. I think it defeats the whole point of a wireless probe.
customer_reviews.author: Brent C. Ketcham

customer_reviews.title: Works great and simple to use. Range is limited..
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a wireless temp gauge to use with my grill and smoker. I was not too worried about the 33-foot range of this model as it was listed as my cookers are on my patio very close to the house. I loved that it gives you an estimated time to done based on the temp rise and curve of the meat heating. The range is limited but it auto reconnects when you get back in range. Overall I love this thing and it seems to be very accurate, I used two other temp gauges to verify the temps and they were all within 2 or three degrees of each other.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Wagoner

customer_reviews.title: This is the best in thermometers!
customer_reviews.text: You cannot beat it, i used it on a Stuffed Bacon Wrapped chicken Breast and it was just perfect, not only does it actually show the ambient temp of the Grill which helps allot it shows the internal temp of the meat exactly right on! and also takes into account resting time of the meat needed. You just set the temp you want for the meat and it also gives you suggestions for well done, medium and so forth, it's just way to perfect! and it's wireless! love the quality of the app also!
customer_reviews.author: Rev Michael

customer_reviews.title: Works well with a learning curve.
customer_reviews.text: So far, I really liked the product. I’ve used it one time and the thick steaks I cooked on the gas grill were very good. The setup was not as intuitive as I would have liked. Also, the unit did not transmit the temp info right away. I have not yet done the setup to WiFi, because it seemed more complicated and I was pressed to get the steaks cooked for our guests. As I use MEATER over time and get used to Its nuances, I hope the experience and satisfaction will continue to increase. I do recommend the product.
customer_reviews.author: KLLAW

customer_reviews.title: It keeps you in the cooking zone...
customer_reviews.text: I can't say enough about this product. Love it! I used it in a reverse sear process and worked great. It really gives you the info you need for accurate cooking. I also did a oven roasted chicken and came out perfect and on a first time try! Keeping connected will be an issue unless you have an extra iPad or iPhone around. I was about to throw my iPad out due to age of it but now that I bought the Meater I have a use for it now. When I'm hooked up to both iPad and my iPhone I can go anyway in the house without fear of losing connection. GREAT PRODUCT AND ABOUT TIME!!!
customer_reviews.author: CR Review

customer_reviews.title: Works Just As Described, but with One Catch
customer_reviews.text: I have used this product on just about every type of meat and for as long as 14 hours straight. Love this thermometer. One VERY important note on this product is to NOT exceed 527 degrees per their recommendation. My MEATER actually broke in half and I sent it in for the warranty. They checked my cooking log and said that I twice exceeded 527 degrees which voided the warranty. They still gave me a replacement which I appreciate but I won't get another one if I exceed it again. That seems fair which is why they still get 5 stars but be sure to not destroy the product by exceeding 527 when searing meats.
customer_reviews.author: Elmhurst

customer_reviews.title: Needs a written manual, otherwise---
customer_reviews.text: Unpackaged the Meater and found a magnifying glass to read the directions (the print is very small). While charging, downloaded the app, went to the Meater website, and found (mostly) promotional information and links to YouTube videos. This is fine for someone who likes to be talked to, but I prefer to read for myself. Anyway, got it all set up, got a roast in the oven, and it was one of the best-cooked roasts ever. Not overcooked, not undercooked, delicious! Looking for more items to cook.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quit working after about 8 months
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to get this thermometer and it worked OK after the first few uses. Then I noticed that the temp was not registering as it should. So I put several different types of probes in what I was cooking and it was showing about 10 degrees hotter then the other 2 probes. Yes, I paid attention to how far the probe was in the meat. Bottom line was it did not give me the right temp. Then after several more cooks it just quit working all together. Not happy at all with this device. Support will not respond to my request to have it fixed or replaced. Probably would recommend that you stay away from this product.
customer_reviews.author: slay3439

customer_reviews.title: Have two and both are trash
customer_reviews.text: Totally unreliable as far as when they decide to work or not. Most of the time I'm left using my fingers to check the cook. The "extended range" of wifi is grossly overstated. Can't tell the two apart--and I'm assuming each requires a specific base. Who knows. I've tried swithing the bases too but the meter starts making the other base blink red or green. Seems like someone's high school project that daddy decided to sell online.
customer_reviews.author: JK in LA

customer_reviews.title: Inaccurate temperature reading and distant range
customer_reviews.text: This is my second MEATER after returning the first one for reporting incorrect temperature readings. The replacement was even worst because it wouldn’t allow me to go more than 2 ft without dropping a connection. When I did try to use it my meat/chicken always came out over or undercooked. I previously used a simple $15 cooking thermometer and my meat and chicken came out perfect every time. I’ll be switching back to the basics.
customer_reviews.author: lexusitaliano

customer_reviews.title: I can make the perfect steaks with these!
customer_reviews.text: I always mess up a good steak. We prefer ours mid rare. I love this MEATER! I've been searing my steaks in a cast iron, then I stick the MEATER in and finish it off in the oven and my phone goes off when they're ready. I can't get over how perfect my steaks have been and how spot on the reading is. I've also used this on pork loins but it gets a little tricky when the meat has largely uneven portions. If you stick the meater in the thickest part it works the best. We've been buying one of these for all of our friends for birthdays and Christmas since we love ours so much!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Do NOT buy ever unless you want to pay a 20% restocking fee
customer_reviews.text: What a great product idea, but it does't work. I returned the first MEATER because it did not charge. It was related. The replacement worked well until the battery died. I don't think the battery died, I think the MEATER again is not charging and now I can't return it. New battery and the little light doesn't turn on to tell you if it is working or not. Skip the frustration. Buy something else. I called Amazon today and spoke to customer NON-service I was told “I needed to pay a 20% restocking fee to return another broken item. What a Disappointment. Amazon you need to do better.
customer_reviews.author: Beverly

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: I love this thermometer, I use it with my pellet smoker and it makes thing so easy. The range is very short, I can't go more than 15 feet without losing signal but then again, my smoker is pretty heavy duty. I just connect to an old phone that I plug in outside and use the cloud to monitor my cook. The only two suggestions I have would be to make it cheaper. I'd buy a lot of them if they weren't so expensive. And add Google Home Assistance compatibility. The ability to use voice commands via Google Home would just about make this thing perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Wolfe

customer_reviews.title: Looses connection after 10 feet! What good is that?!
customer_reviews.text: Good concept but has very bad distance reception. That must be why they now have the updated "+" model. Now I can't return for a refund so I'll write an honest review. Don't waste your money unless you're too lazy to lift the BBQ lid and check temp directly. Also sitting in my kitchen using it in the oven with a glass door - it still has very poor reception Loses connection in 10 feet!
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for grilling or general cooking!
customer_reviews.text: The Meater is amazing. I just finished my third cook with it, this time with a Prime Rib Roast in the regular oven. My Bluetooth signal won't reach everywhere in the house, but I can use my iPad as the stationary, close BT connection and use the app on my iPhone to connect through the Cloud and monitor the progress while working elsewhere in the house. Very accurate and no wires mean I can use it with my rotisserie.
customer_reviews.author: EagleTRL

customer_reviews.title: Great invention!
customer_reviews.text: This is one of those great inventions that I have been wanting for many years and finally it has been invented. The setup is very easy, the use is very user friendly. The price is quite reasonable for the simple version. Only time will tell how well it survives grill temperatures, even following the instructions for insertion. Since i will use primarily for the rotisserie, it will not see constant use and I hope it will last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: L. S. Brodsky

customer_reviews.title: What a letdown
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to use this thermometer but was extremely let down by the entire experience. The app for working it was really low grade and is constantly sending errors for not connecting. You really need to be standing right next to the grill to pick up connection to your phone. The battery doesn't last a full smoke which is kinda pointless if you have to pull out the old reliable thermometer to finish the cook. Really limited on customizing your alerts and what you can track should be able to set ambient temperature ranges with alarms etc Overall until it connects to WiFi and can last the entire cook don't waste your time with this one.
customer_reviews.author: foltsey

customer_reviews.title: Range is not good. Trash!!!!
customer_reviews.text: The 33 foot distance is in perfect conditions, can’t use it when a glass is between you and the grill. Not worth it Sept 13th. The first cook turned out great, I tried to connect again since I knew the data can be stored and updated later in my phone. I Tried to set it up for another cook and it is not connecting. I reinstalled the app and still no connection. So much for using technology to make it easy. I will reply on my experience as a cook from now on. This is trash !!!
customer_reviews.author: Albert  Rice

customer_reviews.title: A bright spot in a crappy year.
customer_reviews.text: Holly crap. My life is complete now. If you don't have one of these and are debating buying one, ponder no more. It will be the best money you spend in what is proving to be a monster year (2020). I got the 33 foot one. If I had to do it again I wouldn't be such a cheap bastard and would have shelled out for the more long distance version. You know you want it, go for it. You will be a better all around person.
customer_reviews.author: Philip J. Sykes

customer_reviews.title: RIPOFF-DONT BUY!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Worst product ever bought. Horrible transmitting range, <3’. Advertised 10 minimum and if i go more than 3ft it drops. When i passed this to the company they outright refused to respond like a responsible company. They actually responded with only a happy face or frown face for me to respond to my concern regarding their blatant false advertising. Surprising since i provided video proof of it not working. Worst company ive ever dealt with, will be reporting to BBB. Dont waste your money
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: A fantastic product! Kudos!
customer_reviews.text: I have waited a little bit for my review to gain enough experience with the gadget in different cooking situations. So far I have used it for meat and fish roasting in the oven and I cannot be happier. Very easy to use, no need for a manual, and easy to clean and store. My only wish would be if the MEATER would develop and test a procedure for testing oven temperatures (always a sticky point) I am very positive that many Meater users would appreciate it!!!!....Thank you!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: DS

customer_reviews.title: couldn't even do 2 uses
customer_reviews.text: It must have overheated because it would not work after the initial use. Dead the next day. I tried to get a replacement but the company stopped prime right after i bought it. Probably had others with the same problem. I really wanted it to work and that's why I'm upset. Their customer support sucks. TAKE CARE OF CUSTOMERS!
customer_reviews.author: k m

customer_reviews.title: Fragile and poor connection range
customer_reviews.text: The accuracy was great. The range aweful. Had to use a tablet on my smoker so that I could use my phone to keep track. Charging station is cool, but doesn't charge even when battery says its good. This lasted for about 7 smokes and then wont charge. The app is ok when setting up a working meter, but no way to remove the pairing and disengage the bad probe. The system is good, but the probe is so fragile it will fry at over 212 degrees and most of my smokes need 220-225 degrees. This is not stated clearly in advertisements. Won't buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: CW

customer_reviews.title: Low Range + Low Heat Resistance + Deteriorates Fast
customer_reviews.text: This thing is really disappointing. It won’t work over 525 degrees Fahrenheit. Most grills get up to 600+ - additionally, the range is not what’s advertised, and keeping it clean and charged is hard. Also, be careful because everyone burns themselves the first couple times using it. Dumb move but it happens. They need some improvements. For one, they should all have a long range, and 2 should have better heat resistance.
customer_reviews.author: ringteam91

customer_reviews.title: Great Concept, Poorly Executed
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Sleek design Compact App is user friendly and laid out well Seems to track temperature correctly inside and out Cons: States a distance of 33ft. it is more like 3ft. Loses signal constantly Love the idea of the Meater and the 2nd edition may have worked these kinks out, but for $70.00 you would think this would allow you to step away from the grill. I cannot even walk away from the grill before losing connection. Was ok while hanging on the deck, but cannot even step in the house without losing connectivity. Also past point of return so I'm stuck with it.
customer_reviews.author: Christina Bunker

customer_reviews.title: Broke 3rd-4th time
customer_reviews.text: Complete waste of money product broke after3rd-4th use and I never put it in the oven once.
customer_reviews.author: TheClark's

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Awesome gadget. Seriously this is a game changer. I’ve cooked many meals now my family calls my an excellent cook. The MEATER is a simple and effective device, the app and UI is excellent and the 33ft connectivity can be easily overcome by using MEATER cloud, for me I leave my iPad (as my primary device) in the kitchen and watch the cook literally anywhere on my iPhone.
customer_reviews.author: William Heger

customer_reviews.title: inaccurate Cooking
customer_reviews.text: everything that I have cooked with it has been way overdone it seems that the internal temperature sensor is Always incorrect so when I choose medium rare Setting I get very well done meat. I tried it with both beef and chicken On the stovetop and on a barbecue and got the same results.
customer_reviews.author: Jay K.

customer_reviews.title: Inaccurate and awkward to set up
customer_reviews.text: Difficult to keep within working Bluetooth range. I basically have to keep my iPad on the stove, then connect my phone to the iPad in order to have any sense of a mobile range. The thermometer also seems to read over by 10 or so degrees, my meat keeps coming out undercooked. The probe is also kind of bulky, so it can really only be used for a large cut of meat, anything pork tenderloin sized or smaller will require some other thermometer.
customer_reviews.author: rachelrg

customer_reviews.title: Perfectly cooked meat & fish every time.
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this product and have used it for roughly a year. Works perfectly with fish, steaks, roasts, chicken, turkey and virtually everything I've used it for. I would recommend the extended range version however, if you cook/ grill with door/ lid closed. When I close the lid on my Weber Charcoal grill or the door of my Samsung gas oven, contact is lost if my phone is more than 5-6 feet away, lid/ door open, it performs pretty close to the specified 33' range. I plan on upgrading to the extended version eventually, but until then I'll turn up the volume on my phone, leave it closer, and continue to enjoy perfectly cooked, meat and fish.
customer_reviews.author: Kirk W.

customer_reviews.title: Not easy to use at all!
customer_reviews.text: I trusted this too much that I used it for the first time on my thanksgiving turkey what a disaster! Could not get to programme , kept telling me my turkey was done when it still had 2 hours to go, tried again, NEVER got a correct read. Tried another evening with steak even used the UTube help and still no good. I intend to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne Moran

customer_reviews.title: Pay extra and get the new version IF you’re set on MEATER
customer_reviews.text: The concepts is good but the range on this first iteration is TERRIBLE. Spend the extra money if you are going to buy this brand for the updated version. I don’t have the new version but I wish I had started with it ... there’s a reason they updated it. I should’ve returned it as not as advertised as the range is actually less than 7ft not the 33ft advertised. If the seller would be willing to take back this MEATER v1.0 ID be happy to pay the difference to try out the new version and review that.
customer_reviews.author: Presley

customer_reviews.title: Seriously disappointing. Connectivity is horrible
customer_reviews.text: The product is beautifully presented in a bamboo box. Looks super high tech. Minor detail. While the features state that the connectivity is 10 ft, and "may be slightly reduced" when using a BBQ or smoker (uh...),the reality is that you get *maybe* a 5 ft range. And the so called Wi-Fi feature is garbage because it relies on the Bluetooth connection in order to hit your wifi network. So, this works if you're using it indoors where you can leave your phone by your oven or skillet. Not worth the spend, so it's going back. Good old wired temperature probe never fails.
customer_reviews.author: Maritza T

customer_reviews.title: Full of Flaws
customer_reviews.text: This device's main attraction is wireless connectivity between the probe and the app. When the connectivity is interrupted every few minutes, even though the proximity between probe and app is less than 2 feet and other similar probes and apps are present that do not fail, then it becomes quickly obvious the MEATER engineers have bugs to workout. Buyer be a-ware....you have other choices.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Used once. It worked but with a caveat.
customer_reviews.text: Used it once to check temp on a steak. It worked OK and the steak came out a nice medium well. But since you need to download their app to use their product the next day I received an email asking how my steak turned out and was I satisfied. So they are monitoring our cooking habits and I find this offensive and will be returning the product.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Nice App, bad Bluetooth connectivity, bad meater link
customer_reviews.text: So originally I gave a 2 because my main issue was the Bluetooth connection. So I tried using meater link since I had a spare tablet. The connection still was lost. Further, the device itself can't take hear over 500 degrees. This blaring uncancellable warning sounds. This thing adds stress not takes it away. Again app was good, eventually letting me know when to take it off the heat for a good cook. Nice app spoiled by bad hardware. Unless I am right next to me grill the Bluetooth connection fails. If I go inside, literally a few feet away it fails to connect. Should be Meater 2 meters
customer_reviews.author: cv1000

customer_reviews.title: Love this gadget
customer_reviews.text: I looked at this for a while before committing. I cooked a prime rib on New Years Eve using it. Came out perfect. Then made a chicken a week later. Perfect again. I like that it will estimate when your meat will be done. My oven temperature is unreliable so the fact that it will show the temp of the food and the temp of the oven is a great thing.
customer_reviews.author: Randall Frech

customer_reviews.title: Confusing and unhelpful
customer_reviews.text: Already used it once but wish I could return it. This is a waste of money. Be careful before you buy, the app is constantly a confusing mess and on top of that it can’t even tell you what the temperature is. You have to tell it what type of meat you are cooking and then it just tells you when it thinks it’s ready, regardless of what temperature your recipe calls for. What’s more, if that not the case, the app is so convoluted, it would be hard to know if there’s some special tab you have to click through to find it. I wouldn’t recommend buying this!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Never worked
customer_reviews.text: Great idea, but it never worked. No clue why. Not discoverable on my iPhone 8s with most current software. Made sure it was charged and that charger was working. Even changed batteries after that and let it recharge again. Complete dud! Returned it for a full refund.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Botteri

customer_reviews.title: Does not work with Ninja foodi grill.
customer_reviews.text: I have tried to give this very expensive product a chance. But it’s just not accurate. The selection for meats is too limited. No ribs, just pork chops. I use my ninja foodi grill and it’s a miss all the time. Then, even if you see that meat is not fully cooked it’ll give you a warning to remove thermostat or it’ll get damaged.
customer_reviews.author: loren

customer_reviews.title: Great product, weak range, but has workarounds to fix
customer_reviews.text: Poor range, but have fixed that with wifi from a second smartphone I leave in range. Love the product minus that. found workaround and am excited to get my preordered block to extend range and have more probes. Only other negative is probe charge lasts only 12 hours or so. Not an issue unless doing a long smoke.
customer_reviews.author: Trent Schwab

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and bird safe if used properly!
customer_reviews.text: This was so easy to use! It walks you through everything you need. The design is so simple it's amazing! Note: No Teflon. If you don't burn or melt your Meater by abusing it, I believe it is bird safe. We have four large partots, and being parrot safe was make-or-break on our decision to buy it. The 33 ft. distance limit is a feature for bird owners. One more reason to stay in the kitchen as you cook! I forgot and went to the living room briefly. The app warned me I was out of range.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy L. Schmidt Carr

customer_reviews.title: A Must Have For Smoking
customer_reviews.text: This is a great thermometer, and I think what puts this above other brands is the GUI of the App. I am an engineer, so obviously I love my data. Being able to track the temp of the ambient air and the meat at the same time is great. And, the ability to save previous cooks with notes only amplifies my ability to get the meat spot on each time. My only complaint is that with my smoker, I have to be pretty close for the bluetooth to connect. If I buy another, I will most likely purchase the version with the cloud option.
customer_reviews.author: Dustin Perrin

customer_reviews.title: Love this device. Love the software, highly recommended.
customer_reviews.text: OMG I love this device. It fulfills a need for a geeky thermometer I never knew I had. Sent one to my BBQ friend already. The ambient temperature seems to run a bit low unless you are sticking out the side of the meat. Amazing for long smoking. Everything is adjustable to your preference. I wish I had purchased the longer range one, remember a metal BBQ makes a good fariday cage.
customer_reviews.author: SciFi Fan of fans

customer_reviews.title: The Meater turned me from a below average griller to a grill master
customer_reviews.text: I was also was scared about over cooking my meat and under cooking my meat. Flip flopping it on the grill. Constantly opening the grill to check on it. "If you're looking, you're not cooking". I now have the confidence to leave the lid closed and can see what's going on. I'm 30, my dad's 68 and can hardly work his cell phone. He bought a Meater+ after seeing mine and seeing how well the chicken turned out. That is all the convincing you should need.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie McAllister

customer_reviews.title: Limited range - 10 feet fully charged, not for outdoor distance
customer_reviews.text: We absolutely love the ease of use, app, and product. However it doesn’t have enough range for us to have it in the Traeger while the phone (app) is right inside, 12 feet away. Returned to buy the Meater Plus. This is perfect if you’re only going to use it in the house, no grill barrier or outdoor doors to block the range.
customer_reviews.author: jhl59

customer_reviews.title: Reads lower than actual
customer_reviews.text: I've found after using the MEATER a couple of times that the ambient and food temps read low. I've used my usual probe thermometer unit from GrillEye to verify, and found the MEATER to be running low. There's a larger discrepancy on the ambient than internal. I'd say in terms of steak doneness, it's reading one level low (reading medium when it's actually medium-well). Also, the range is not as advertised, I can't be more than three feet from my grill or I lose connection. Bought this because Guga (YouTube) uses it with great results. It's not working for me. Bummed out about it.
customer_reviews.author: Joel Gross

customer_reviews.title: Great Thermometer
customer_reviews.text: This is the second Meater thermometer I've purchased. This one was a father's day gift. It's also great for oven cooking. All the meat I've cooked with the MEATER has been moist and not dried out. It has a built in "rest" for any meat you cook. It would be nice if it had a wider range. I have had a bit of trouble connecting devices to make the range longer.
customer_reviews.author: Pam Stef

customer_reviews.title: Good product, but range is short
customer_reviews.text: I had trouble connecting the first two times I used this. It turns out that the phone needs to be about two feet away from the probe to make and keep a connection (I was baking a roast in the oven). So, don't expect to maintain a connection if you move farther away than that. The app is slick and it does what it says it does.
customer_reviews.author: NWguy

customer_reviews.title: Works great, but limited range
customer_reviews.text: This works great, but range of wireless to phone is limited. They now have a version that the charger wood box is a repeater or extender that gives much more range which I wish I had waited for. Still happy with this, but would rather have the extended range also.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Dale A. Stagg

customer_reviews.title: Finally a Bluetooth Oven thermometer
customer_reviews.text: I use this for the first time today. Pretty easy to set up. Very easy to use. A little confusing on how to connected to Wi-Fi. But I figured it out. My only complaint is I cooked a roast in a Dutch oven. As soon as I put the lid on the Dutch oven, it lost the signal. So I had to switch from my Dutch oven lid to a foil lid. That’s a little disappointing. Tomorrow I will try it with the turkey.
customer_reviews.author: Michael D. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Damaged after two minutes
customer_reviews.text: I did all steps as in instruction, put it into steak with one inch out as in instruction. After two minutes of usage it got warning message something like: "Remove item to not damaged it". That's it. And it stopped responding. The problem is that due to COVID19 I did not use it for long time, and once I figured out it was damaged, it was too late to return. So I simply lost my money for nothing. During that two minutes it was not easy to use as user interface was not clear enough and contained too many items on it which made operation difficult (I am web developer and I know what the User Experience is).
customer_reviews.author: Arsen Movsesyan

customer_reviews.title: Only works WITHIN 10 feet of your grill, SOMETIMES!
customer_reviews.text: This device is a waste of money. I was finally able to connect it to my iPhone, only to realize it had to be within TEN feet to provide data while cooking. Today I attempted to use with our turkey on the grill, but no go since the turkey has foil on top. I guess the signal is not strong enough to pass through the grill lid and foil.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Maynor

customer_reviews.title: Good, but do not buy only because it looks cool.
customer_reviews.text: It Is almost great, the program is basic, the connection is « old school » bluetooth, but it works fine, you should be able to add the lenght and weight of the cut, but it’s not 100% accurate. Definetely it is a premium price for this type of product, don’t but it just because you think it’s cool or saw it on a YouTube Chanel, buy it only of you always do BBQ’s or over meals and want to surprise your friends or look cool on a social media post, I’m happy with mine, looks good, helps, but could use a bit more app development and features.
customer_reviews.author: Francisco Távara

customer_reviews.title: Bluetooth connectivity stable even under extreme test conditions
customer_reviews.text: I have successfully tested the MEATER probe Bluetooth connectivity under very demanding conditions! One such test I placed the MEATER Probe into a beef roast, placed the roast inside an enameled cast iron seven quart pot then placed the pot inside a Breville Smart Air electric convection oven (see photo). I established connectivity via Bluetooth to an iPod, then Utilizing MEATE Link to connect to WiFi, allowing me to monitor the entire cook from my iPhone. Super easy setup and worked flawlessly without any interruption to connectivity for the duration of the cook! My experience has yielded outstanding results, cook after cook This product works as advertised, perhaps better. The results are very impressive and extraordinarily tasty!
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Spampinato

customer_reviews.title: Meh.
customer_reviews.text: Very cool concept but flawed (or I have a bad unit). Works great with lid off of grill or smoker, but once lid on, I have severe connection issues. I have to keep my phone near the vent of the smoker to get signal. Have to be careful on a hot grill otherwise you can damage it. 1Not to impressed
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Much better than wired thermometers.
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome unit for the grill! Love that there are no wires to worry about. The ambient sensor on the end of the wireless probe works great. The unit connects easily, works especially well if you have two smart devices. I keep an iPad connected by Bluetooth just inside the house from the grill, then I can get all of the readings on my iPhone no matter where I am.
customer_reviews.author: Wade

customer_reviews.title: Short range, accurate results
customer_reviews.text: The good; this thermometer is perfectly accurate, and the app is intuitive. I've used this a handful of times, and received impressive results with beef, pork, and chicken. The bad; when my meat is in the oven, I need to leave my phone near the oven, I get about a 3-foot range before the app loses connection to the probe. Get the higher end model with the range extender.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Won't Connect
customer_reviews.text: I bought my Meater back in November and it worked great. Now unfortunately it will not connect while even sitting on top of my phone. I will try and contact their customer service and will adjust my review as necessary. Edit: lowering my review to 1 star. I contacted customer service through the meater website on Jun 7th about my issue and still haven't received a reply. I went ahead and just tossed my meater in the trash.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Bought (2) of these prior to Thanksgiving hoping to use one of them for our turkey. If I moved my phone more than two feet away from the oven, I would lose the Bluetooth connection. Tried using the other probe on our Weber grill for a steak, and had the same problem. Also, neither probe measured the ambient temperature inside the oven or grill correctly. Oven was set for 350, but the probe measured 260 at best. Customer service was responsive, but tried to explain the problem away as user error. Returned both units for full refund.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Finally, a phenomenal meat thermometer. I wasted so much money on thermometers and gave up, then I saw the Meter ad and figure I would give it a shot. It is fantastic. I've only cooked steak with it but it has been perfect. Just keep the probe in, set the temp on your phone and cook. I just turn the meat every few minutes until it tells me to remove from the grill and rest. Idiot proof! Med rare Everytime.
customer_reviews.author: B. Kaplan

customer_reviews.title: Will not stay connected
customer_reviews.text: I wish I heeded the 26% 1 star reviews. Bought this for use in my Orion smoker. During the 90 min cook the probe only connected to the app a few short times. Even when I held the phone inches away from the probe inside the Orion. Cool idea, but don’t make my mistake.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: great cooking accessory
customer_reviews.text: no cords dangling from the oven/grill. keeps ambient temp along with the meat temp. I like the app as well, very detailed. the only downside is the charging time. If I could change anything, I'd have a usb port to allow charging without battery strength. I cook a lot and will blow thru batteries.
customer_reviews.author: J B Warren

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for perfect steaks
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for a year with perfectly cooked steaks, lamb, pork, chicken and fish as a result. With the lid down on my grill, I can't be more than 20 feet away until my phone Bluetooth disconnects. The time remaining also fluctuates - it took a bit of time to get used to. That said, Meater does its job well without having to keep poking food or going to the grill to check my thermometer.
customer_reviews.author: Cambodad

customer_reviews.title: Very cool device
customer_reviews.text: This device is a technological wonder. The fact that it can sit in an oven and send a signal to an iPhone through the closed oven door and give me an accurate temperature reading is pretty impressive. Cooking by temperature is so much better than cooking by time, and this device does it in spades!
customer_reviews.author: JR

customer_reviews.title: Great item
customer_reviews.text: I don’t know yet I haven’t used it yet. Great looking and design came right on after charge. The phone app worked well. Will actually use it soon and report back if it works as good as it looks. After used I love this device. Best chicken I’ve ever cooked. I watched tv the whole time.
customer_reviews.author: Jseb

customer_reviews.title: Pass
customer_reviews.text: Great concept, disconnects constantly, from 4 ft away, through glass! JUNK!
customer_reviews.author: Andrew A. Wiss

customer_reviews.title: High Tech Wonder
customer_reviews.text: My husband LOVES this meat thermometer! High tech but so easy to use with signals and photos right to his phone. The meat comes out perfect every time. The ease of keeping it on our frig is another plus. This would be a great gift for the holidays.
customer_reviews.author: Alphons Gunther

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy. Good ideas. Bad execution.
customer_reviews.text: I cannot get his to pair with my phone. Worst directions I’ve ever seen. Actually, no directions. Just links to YouTube videos. Still can get to to link. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Rob Conforti

customer_reviews.title: So easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I love everything about Meater. I have never cooked a beef tenderloin roast and this thermometer allowed me to knock it out of the park - the tenderloin was tender, juicy and the perfect medium rare. Dinner was outstanding - true restaurant quality. I served the tenderloin with twice-baked potatoes and sugar snap peas. It was a big hit!
customer_reviews.author: MaggieMae

customer_reviews.title: Cracked on first use (grill)
customer_reviews.text: Heat got too high I guess and cracked the ceramic end. Temperature was around 400 degrees inside of the grill and it was not in direct contact with any flame. Replacing product, hopefully the next is better. Other than the cracked end, the product worked great and took a significant amount of guesswork out of the cooking process.
customer_reviews.author: Anwar

customer_reviews.title: It does exactly what it says it will do, with a few bonus features built in.
customer_reviews.text: Used it for the first time, cooking a 5oz sirloin in a 4” fry pan made for egge-on an old-fashioned heater grating at work that woldn’t go over 237 degrees. The steak came out perfect-tender and juicy. The app is very well thought-out and is user-friendly, keeping track of the progress and letting you know when to remove from heat, and when the rest period is over. Best $69 I’ve spent for the kitchen in a long time
customer_reviews.author: Robert A. McCue

customer_reviews.title: Constant Bluetooth connection issues
customer_reviews.text: This Bluetooth meat thermometer is great in theory, but it's near-constant Bluetooth connection issues make it a complete waste of $80. The attached image was taken just outside of the grill. Maybe two feet away. It never reconnected. I can't recall a time I've been as disappointed with a product.
customer_reviews.author: Nickolas Bailey

customer_reviews.title: Love it! This is what I was looking for!
customer_reviews.text: Love this thermometer! I use it primarily in my smoker, so I did have to use an old cell phone near the smoker to complete the “link” in order to be able to monitor my long cooks from inside. Also works great in the oven. Gave one as a gift to a friend as well, overall great product, I’ll likely buy another this summer for cookouts. App is easy to use, and it’s very smart, perfect results every time!
customer_reviews.author: Someguy

customer_reviews.title: I wish I could review the product, but the app forces you to allow location
customer_reviews.text: I would have liked to use the product and know if it works well or not. But, the app FORCES you to allow it to know your location so it "can connect to blue tooth", what a load of garbage. And, if you do not allow location and go to the blue tooth menu to find devices, the app shuts off blue tooth, no joke. As soon as I uninstalled the app.... no problem. Blue tooth does not need to know anything about your location to pair. I have no intention of using the cloud service, but, if you want to use this product, get ready to tell the company where you are
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Pricey, but I still recommend
customer_reviews.text: What a great thermometer! So easy to use. Very accurate temperature gauge. My only issue was use in the oven really limits the range, but being able to link other devices was very helpful. Would be very annoying if you don’t have other devices to link to, though. My turkey came out absolutely perfect! Completely takes out the guess work and the constant checking. It is a little pricey for a cooking thermometer, but I’m extremely happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: JuniperRose2005

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I love this little thing! It was a pain in the neck to get set up, it would not connect. After getting it to connect it's been great! My only complaint is the distance. From the smoker to the house is about 5 ft and it loses signal all the time. I would definitely look into this. Overall, I would high recommend this to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: Awesome but buy the next model up
customer_reviews.text: This is great. The system works great and is easy to set up. I love that there are no wires. However, don’t get the regular one, get the plus or the block. This promotes a range of 33’ but did not work like that in reality. It only reached a few feet at best in real life. I am sending mine back for the plus model.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing Performance
customer_reviews.text: Cool looking, but doesn’t perform well. I gave it two stars instead of one because it did work the first two times I used it. After that it wouldn’t connect to my iPhone 8 Plus no matter what I did. I’m outside my return window so I’m stuck with a $70 piece of crap.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Kraus

product_meta.title: Original MEATER | 33ft True Wireless Smart Meat Thermometer for The Oven Grill Kitchen BBQ Rotisserie with Bluetooth and WiFi Digital Connectivity
feature_bullets: ► 100% Wire-Free: No wires. No fuss. The first truly wireless smart meat thermometer. Monitor your cook using the FREE app available for iOS (10.3 and later) / Android (5.0 and later) smart phones and tablets.
► 2 Sensors, 1 Probe: Dual temperature sensors can monitor internal meat temperature up to 212°F and ambient / external temperature up to 527°F simultaneously. Dishwasher safe.

► Guided Cook System: Walks you through every step of the cooking process to guarantee perfect and consistent results. You can also set up custom alerts / notifications based on temperature and/or time.
► Advanced Estimator Algorithm: Can estimate how long to cook and rest your food to help plan your meal and manage your time.

► Connectivity Suite: Monitor your cook from a phone or tablet over Bluetooth. Extend your wireless range using MEATER Link WiFi and the MEATER Cloud to use Alexa and monitor your cook from a computer.

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
